meanings.definition: Make (someone) capable of a particular action or state.
meanings.sent1: By practicing regularly, she was capacitating herself to run a marathon.
meanings.sent2: The training program was capacitating the employees to handle complex tasks.
meanings.sent3: He joked that drinking coffee in the morning was capacitating him to face the day.
meanings.sent4: The mentor's guidance was capacitating the young entrepreneur to navigate the business world.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement was capacitating the students to believe in themselves.

meanings.definition: Provide with the capacity to do something.
meanings.sent1: The new software was capacitating the team to work more efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The scholarship was capacitating students to pursue higher education.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was capacitating him to fly through the sky.
meanings.sent4: The music was capacitating her to express emotions she couldn't put into words.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight streaming through the window was capacitating the room with warmth.
